author: doops.
title: Leisure Suit Larry 1-7 are being delisted from Steam "soon" News - PC | ResetEra
text:
Leisure Suit Larry 6 - Shape Up Or Slip Out - Time for Larry to Retire (Just a Little Bit üòåüçπ - Steam News
Dear Larry Fans, After decades of questionable pickup lines and unforgettable adventures, it‚Äôs finally time for Larry to hang up his leisure suit‚Äîat least the retro version of it! The following classic titles will soon be leaving the Steam store and will no longer be available for purchase...
store.steampowered.com
Dear Larry Fans,
After decades of questionable pickup lines and unforgettable adventures, it's finally time for Larry to hang up his leisure suit‚Äîat least the retro version of it!
The following classic titles will soon be leaving the Steam store and will no longer be available for purchase:
- Leisure Suit Larry - Magna Cum Laude Uncut and Uncensored
- Leisure Suit Larry 1 - In the Land of the Lounge Lizards
- Leisure Suit Larry 2 - Looking For Love (In Several Wrong Places)
- Leisure Suit Larry 3 - Passionate Patti in Pursuit of the Pulsating Pectorals
- Leisure Suit Larry 5 - Passionate Patti Does a Little Undercover Work
- Leisure Suit Larry 6 - Shape Up Or Slip Out
- Leisure Suit Larry 7 - Love for Sail
But don't worry! If you already own any of these retro gems, they'll stay right in your library‚Äîready to play anytime you need a nostalgic dose of Larry's misadventures.
And if you're not done with Larry just yet, his latest escapades are still available:
- üí¶ Leisure Suit Larry ‚Äì Wet Dreams Don't Dry
- üí¶ Leisure Suit Larry ‚Äì Wet Dreams Dry Twice
Thanks for keeping Larry company all these years‚Äîhe couldn't have done it without you!

author: Photo submitted
title: Ironman Wisconsin returns on Sept. 8 | News | veronapress.com
text:
IRONMAN Wisconsin will return to the Verona area on Sunday, Sept. 8.
According to a press release, athletes from around the world will converge on Madison to tackle this grueling triathlon, which features a world-renowned bike course that runs right through Verona. Known for its challenging hills and enthusiastic crowds, the Verona loop is a fan-favorite and a true test of endurance.
Last year, IRONMAN Wisconsin was voted the #1 IRONMAN in North America for athlete experience, thanks in large part to the incredible fan support in Verona.
This year, IRONMAN Wisconsin hopes to see even more excitement at the annual Loop Festival on the grounds of St. Christopher‚Äôs Church, 301 N. Main St. Highlights include a brand new Fan Zone across Main Street ‚Äì outside of New Century/Verona Area International School ‚Äì along with a variety of food, drinks and activities:
Coffee & Donut stand by the Knights of Columbus
Brat & Steak Stand by the Knights of Columbus
Custard, Sundaes & Drinks by the Verona Area High School Cross Country Club
Baked Goods by the Verona Area High School Dance Team
Popcorn, Beverages and Treats by the Verona Area High School Theatre Department
Punt-Pass-Kick, Free-Throw and Soccer Contests by the Knights of Columbus
Fan Zone at New Century Charter School with an Obstacle Course, Sign-Making, Bike Loop Bingo and Scavenger Hunt. Courtesy of the Verona Area School District Community Education Program
Motorists should note traffic delays and road closures to accommodate the event between 8 a.m. and 5:30 p.m. According to a Facebook post from the Verona Police Department, officers will staff major intersections.
Cones will differentiate between vehicle travel and bike lanes in some areas.
‚ÄúPlease be patient and plan to use alternate routes to avoid bike traffic,‚Äù the post states. ‚ÄúThere will be an increase in traffic due to race observers and other unrelated events occurring at various locations throughout Verona that day.‚Äù
Photo provided by the Verona Police Department

author: Jorick Margrit
title: Hautes-Alpes: la Coordination Rurale d√©voile sa liste pour les √©lections agricoles de 2025
text:
Dans un mois se tiendront les √©lections de la chambre d'agriculture d√©partementale des Hautes-Alpes et r√©gionale de Provence-Alpes-C√¥te d'Azur. Une occasion pour la Coordination Rurale des Hautes-Alpes de tenter d'am√©liorer la situation dans les fermes de la r√©gion. √Ä l'approche des √©lections des chambres d'agriculture , pr√©vues le 31 janvier 2025, la Coordination Rurale des Hautes-Alpes a pr√©sent√© ce jeudi 26 d√©cembre, √† Montmaur, sa liste et ses ambitions. Men√©e par Serge Jousselme, pr√©sident du syndicat, cette √©quipe de vingt √©leveurs et agriculteurs souhaite porter des projets concrets pour r√©pondre aux d√©fis actuels de l'agriculture.
"Si nous arrivons √† la t√™te de la Chambre d'Agriculture, nous aimerions l'ouvrir √† l'ensemble des listes, car nous n'avons pas l'exclusivit√© des id√©es" d√©clare √† BFM DICI Serge Jousselme √† la Ferme du Lauzon, o√π les membres de la liste se sont r√©unis.
"Il est n√©cessaire de rassembler toutes nos id√©es pour avancer ensemble", poursuit-il.
Des priorit√©s d√©j√† trac√©es Parmi leurs principales revendications, la Coordination Rurale des Hautes-Alpes met en avant la n√©cessit√© de garantir un revenu d√©cent aux agriculteurs. "Le plus important, c'est de leur redonner une dignit√© financi√®re," insiste Serge Jousselme.
Cela passe notamment par une revalorisation des retraites, avec un minimum de 100% du SMIC, et la suppression d'un article de loi qui p√©nalise les retrait√©s ayant cotis√© √† plusieurs r√©gimes.
Ils souhaitent √©galement favoriser la valorisation locale des produits agricoles. "Des prix, pas des primes!", clame le syndicat, appelant √† des tarifs justes pour assurer un revenu durable aux exploitants.
La simplification des d√©marches administratives figure aussi parmi les priorit√©s. "Nous voulons travailler dans nos champs, pas dans des bureaux!", s'indigne le pr√©sident. Pour la Coordination Rurale, des mesures concr√®tes doivent √™tre mises en place, notamment pour faciliter l'entretien des cours d'eau et g√©rer les r√©serves collinaires pour l'irrigation.
Une agriculture face aux d√©fis de la pr√©dation La protection des √©levages reste un enjeu majeur dans les Hautes-Alpes. Face √† la menace persistante des loups , la Coordination Rurale 05 milite pour un renforcement des dispositifs de protection et une r√©vision des mesures existantes, jug√©es inefficaces. Plusieurs actions que le syndicat esp√®re pouvoir d√©fendre en pr√©sentant sa participation √† l'√©lection.
Quant √† la liste, elle est compos√©e de 20 candidats issus de divers secteurs agricoles qui incarnent la diversit√© du d√©partement. Aux c√¥t√©s de Serge Jousselme figurent, entre autres, Marine Gohier, √©leveuse bio √† Montmaur, M√©lanie Costanzo, arboricultrice et pr√©sidente d'Alpes Coop Fruit et Bruno Andr√©, pr√©sident de l'abattoir de Gap.
Tous partagent un m√™me objectif: replacer "le bon sens paysan" au c≈ìur des d√©cisions, tout en pr√©parant une agriculture innovante et respectueuse de l'environnement. Un retour aux valeurs fondamentales et √† un combat renouvel√© pour pr√©server l'exception agricole fran√ßaise.
Sur le m√™me sujet Alpes-de-Haute-Provence: les candidats aux √©lections de la Chambre d'agriculture se d√©voilent Alpes-de-Haute-Provence: Laurent Depieds, candidat aux √©lections de la Chambre d'agriculture Avec dix r√©unions publiques pr√©vues d√®s le 3 janvier dans tout le d√©partement, le syndicat esp√®re mobiliser largement pour faire entendre sa vision d'une agriculture durable, √©quitable et respectueuse des agriculteurs.
Jorick Margrit Les plus lus
"Nettoyer les prisons", narcotrafic, consentement... Ce que veut faire G√©rald Darmanin √† la Justice

author: Sarah Motter
title: Charges filed after medical professional kidnapped for prescription drugs
text:
SEDALIA, Mo. (KCTV) - A Sedalia man has been charged with kidnapping after he allegedly forced a medical professional to help him gain access to prescription drugs he intended to sell.
Pettis County, Missouri, Circuit Court records filed on Tuesday, Dec. 17, have revealed that Phoenix M. Painter Torres, 26, of Sedalia, now faces charges including kidnapping after a disturbance at a medical office.
A probable cause statement filed by the Pettis County Sheriff‚Äôs Office indicated that around 6:15 p.m. on Monday, law enforcement officials were called to the Pettis County Courthouse and Annex with reports of a disturbance. When they arrived, they found Painter Torres who was taken into custody.
Investigators said they found Painter Torres showed up at the home of a medical professional where he threatened her and forced her to take him to her office at the Annex. Once at the victim‚Äôs office, he allegedly stole a bottle of Codeine syrup. An unlabeled bottle of Xanax was also found in his possession.
Throughout the course of the investigation, it was alleged that Painter Torres attempted to get the Xanax to sell it illegally. As a result, he was charged with kidnapping, possession of a controlled substance, stealing and violation of a protection order.
As of Thursday, Dec. 19, Painter Torres remains behind bars with no bond listed. A hearing has been scheduled for 1:30 p.m. on Jan. 7. No further information has been released.
Copyright 2024 KCTV. All rights reserved.

author: Staff Reporter
title: The aviation industry is failing its climate goals 'dramatically,' experts say
text:
Current and former aviation professionals have rallied together to call for a fundamental transition of the industry.
According to a report in the Guardian , the newly formed Call Aviation to Action believes the industry is overly optimistic about emissions-cutting technology and stuck in a business model that requires ever-increasing flight numbers.
Carbon dioxide emissions from aviation are not part of any national country plan. Instead, they are governed by the International Civil Aviation Organization (ICAO), a UN body that is ‚Äúfailing dramatically‚Äù at tackling greenhouse gas emissions in the industry according to Karel Bockstael, a co-founder of the group, and a vice-president of sustainability at KLM Royal Dutch Airlines until 2022.
Criticised by experts as ‚Äú unambitious and problematic ‚Äù, the ICAO‚Äôs Corsia scheme took eight years to create and amounts to nothing more than voluntary carbon offsets, doing nothing to actually curb emissions at the source. ‚ÄúIf we do not act, by 2050 aviation emissions will be about a quarter of all human-caused emissions,‚Äù Bockstael warned. ‚ÄúWe hope our initiative will help a really big group of aviation professionals to speak up, because we think they‚Äôre the silent majority.‚Äù
Launched on Tuesday, Call Aviation to Action has amassed nearly 200 members eager to chart a new, sustainable course for the future. The group has four goals for this year, the first centering on setting absolute emission reduction targets in line with carbon budgets as ‚Äúdelayed action makes the problem harder to tackle.‚Äù
[ See more: Macao pledges support for sustainable development MIECF ]
The second is a new approach to lobbying, actively advocating for and implementing regulation to keep the industry on track, ensure a level playing field, and drive innovation. Striving for perfect policies, they say, should not delay the implementation of already good ones.
Thirdly, the group wants a realistic approach to the availability of new technologies, in terms of time, scale, cost and business planning. Lastly, it calls on the industry to acknowledge that managing global demand fairly is part of the solution.
Constraints on demand such as flight or carbon taxes, Bockstael noted, should offer equitable access to flying in developing countries and address heavy frequent flyers in rich countries ‚Äì just one percent of the world‚Äôs population is responsible for half of aviation emissions . Instead of the industry adding more and more routes, the group also advocates for intelligent demand management, focused on maintaining the societally most valuable connections so that air travel remains available to the largest group of people and those who rely on it the most.
For those who have already joined the group, this simple but revolutionary outlook is energising after so many years of delay.
‚ÄúI can‚Äôt wait to see the aviation industry leadership finally getting real about the climate crisis and mobilising the imagination and courage from which flying was born in the first place,‚Äù said Jan Ernst de Groot, former managing director and executive board member of KLM.
 ‚ÄúThe climate can has been kicked down the road for too long,‚Äù he told the Guardian .

author: Sam Hall
title: F2 Espa√±a: Martins gana y Correa logra su primer podio desde el accidente de 2019
text: Victor Martins ofreci√≥ una clase magistral para encarrilar su campa√±a en la F2 con la victoria en la carrera Sprint espa√±ola. El piloto de ART hab√≠a tenido problemas en las primeras rondas de la nueva temporada, pero demostr√≥ toda su habilidad al convertir una segunda posici√≥n de salida en el liderato en la curva 1 y ya no mir√≥ atr√°s. Martins adelant√≥ a Ritomo Miyata, aunque el piloto de Rodin fue relegado a la octava posici√≥n tras recibir dos penalizaciones de cinco segundos por exceder los l√≠mites de la pista. Roman Stanek (Trident) y Zane Maloney (Rodin) fueron sancionados, mientras que Franco Colapinto, Dennis Hauger (MP Motorsport) y Maloney, una vez m√°s, fueron objeto de investigaciones posteriores a la carrera. Tras una mala salida desde la pole, Kush Maini (Invicta) cay√≥ hasta la quinta posici√≥n en los primeros compases, pero no tard√≥ en remontar hasta situarse a rebufo de Miyata. No solo fue el primer viaje de Martins al podio esta temporada, sino que tambi√©n fue la primera pieza de plata para Juan Manuel Correa (DAMS) desde el horrible accidente en B√©lgica en 2019 en el que sufri√≥ m√∫ltiples lesiones. Juan Manuel Correa, Dams Foto: Simon Galloway \/ Motorsport Images Hizo un movimiento en la pen√∫ltima vuelta sobre Gabriel Bortoleto (Invicta), cuyos neum√°ticos hab√≠an ca√≠do al precipicio. Fue otro d√≠a para olvidar tambi√©n para Prema, ya que tanto Andrea Kimi Antonelli como Oliver Bearman tuvieron problemas, con el primero terminando P10 y el segundo cayendo como una piedra a la parte trasera del pelot√≥n antes de entrar en boxes. Volvi√≥ a la pista y termin√≥ en P21, a 41s de la cabeza. En realidad, la acci√≥n fue limitada, con los coches formando r√°pidamente trenes de DRS y vi√©ndose obligados a gestionar los neum√°ticos debido a los alt√≠simos niveles de degradaci√≥n habituales en el Circuit de Barcelona-Catalunya. Paul Aron (Hitech) mantuvo su liderato del campeonato con un cuarto puesto, mientras que su principal rival, Isack Hadjar (Campos) s√≥lo pudo ser s√©ptimo. La ca√≠da de Maloney en la clasificaci√≥n de pilotos continu√≥, ya que el otrora l√≠der del campeonato lleg√≥ a casa en la P19.
